text: Rene Sylva (January 1929 â€“ December 28, 2008) was an American botanist. He was born in Paia, Hawaii. He was among the only native Hawaiian fishermen to speak in favor of a ban on fishing green sea turtles."Former Turtle Fisherman Honored" Marine Turtle Newsletter 1994 After giving up a career in turtle fishing, he became involved in the conservation of native Hawaiian ecosystems. He was important for the surveying remote regions of the Hawaiian Islands for native plants.Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Proposed Endangered Status for 10 Plant Taxa From Maui Nui, Hawaii | Federal Register Environmental Documents | USEPA ==References== Category:1929 births Category:American botanists Category:Scientists from Hawaii Category:People from Maui Category:2008 deaths
title: Rene Sylva
